title: What do staff say about support from their managers and how has it changed?
analysis_commentary:
This question in the staff survey asks people to rank how supportive their managers are on a scale of 1 to 5 where a score of 1 represents unsupportive managers and 5 represents supportive managers. There has also been very little variation between different trust types. Staff in ambulance trusts reported a lower level of support from their managers. The difference is only approximately 0.5 points - on the 1-5 scale - lower than the national result.

There were no differences in reported satisfaction with the support staff received between the different staff groups we investigated (Medical/dental staff; Registered nurses; Healthcare assistants; Health visitors; Social care staff; AHP, Scientific & technical staff; General managers; Wider healthcare team, which includes administration/central functions/corporate/maintenance) or staff characteristics (age, sex, disability and ethnicity - white vs. non-white).

The national report (see 'About this data' for more details) states that in 2015, 67% of staff were satisfied with the support that they received from their immediate manager.
